page.title: 08Local Religion
page.content: There are 3 churches and chapels in the area they are called st.Peters church st.Marys st.Endellion. There are quite a lot of places of worship in the area because all the village used to go church . Not all of them are used today as not many people go to church regularly. The oldest church is St. Endellion where the vicar Father Hugh Fryer lives. The cemetery is at st. Endellion and there are the remains of many sailors drowned around the coast buried here. The methodist minister is Rev. Young He has been a minister for 15 years and preaches in 10 other chapels apart from the one in Port Isaac. There used to be 2 chapels in the village but one of them has recently been pulled down. Some old chapels are made into houses and holiday cottages.
